info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:02PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 1202 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over West Palm Beach. This storm was nearly stationary.
HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph, and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... West Palm Beach, Riviera Beach, Royal Palm Beach, Lake Park, Haverhill, Cloud Lake, Palm Beach International Airport, Schall Circle, Royal Palm Estates, Lake Belvedere Estates, Golden Lakes, Gun Club Estates, Port Of Palm Beach, Mangonia Park, Glen Ridge, Lakeside Green, Plantation Mobile Home Park, Stacey Street, Century Village, and Westgate-Belvedere Homes.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Palm Beach County through 1230 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Metro Palm Beach County; Coastal Palm Beach County
